result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah E North was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work and Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens at least 1 time per month.

No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.
No contact with known illegal drug users/manufacturers/deliverers.
No contact with codefendant Ricardo Roman.
Defendant may not possess more than 1 cell phone.
No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation.

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
All costs, surcharges and assessment including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid by the end of probation or to convert to a civil judgment.
Court does not access a fine.
Maintain full time/part time employment and/or education.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah E North

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Noah North in court.  Attorney Joe Domask in court for Noah North.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 5:  Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
As to Count 6:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work and Day Reporting Center with credit for 8 days time served.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 1 year probation.
Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- Random urine screens at least 1 time per month.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- No possession of drug paraphernalia.
- No contact with known illegal drug users/manufacturers/deliverers.
- No contact with co-defendant Ricardo Roman
- Defendant may not possess more than 1 cell phone.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- Maintain full time/part time employment and/or education.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause

Court does not access a fine.
Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation 
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.  
Appeal rights given
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Defendant Noah E North in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduled plea and sentencing. All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Noah E North in court with attorney Caitlin H. Firer.  Defendant Noah E North in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Noah E North appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
